title.narrative: UNDP - Ixil Rural Development Joint Program

description.narrative: Insatsen ”Gemensamma programmet för landsbygdsutveckling i Ixil” har utvecklats under ramverket för den i övergångsrättvisa förekommande principen om icke-upprepning (aldrig mer-principen) såsom ett svar på en begäran från offren under den interna väpnade konflikten i Guatemala om att adressera möjligheten till ekonomiska och andra utvecklingsmöjligheter på lokal nivå och som ett komplement till "Program till stöd för övergångsrättvisa i Guatemala PAJUST", vilket stöds och har stötts av Sverige under flera år. Programmet är ett integrerat landsbygdsutvecklingsprogram som har som mål att öka återhämtningsmöjligheterna för de familjer som föll offer för den interna väpnade konflikten i Santa María Nebaj, Cotzal och Chajul, som samtliga tillhör regionen Quiché i Guatemala genom en helhetssyn på landsbygdsutveckling vilken även omfattar ett hållbart brukande och förvaltning av naturresurser. Helhetssynen omfattar att arbeta med familjer som driver småbruk för det egna uppehället, för att förbättra familjernas hälsa, näringsintag, boende och närområde, förvaltning och hantering av utveckling ifråga om resurser och naturresurser samt kunskaper i företagande. Programmet kombinerar sagda teman med att arbeta med lokala och centrala myndigheter verksamma i Ixil för att utveckla och förbättra kunskaperna inom staten för att uppnå ett inkluderande och fredligt styre utifrån ett rättighets- och återhämtningsperspektiv.

The program Ixil Rural Development Joint Program has been designed under the framework of non-repetition measures of Transitional Justice, as a response to armed conflict victims request to access to economic and local development opportunities and as a complement to PAJUST- Transitional Justice Program sponsored by Embassy of Sweden in Guatemala. The program is an integral rural development program that aims to increase resilience of families victims of armed conflict in Santa María Nebaj, Cotzal and Chajul, department of Quiché,Guatemala, through a holistic rural development approach and natural resources sustainable management. The holistic approach includes working with families with agricultural productions subsistence and infra subsistence to improve their health, nutrition, habitat, development management, natural resources governance and their entrepreneurship capabilities. As well as, working with local government and central government institutions delegated in the Ixil region to develop capacities to reach inclusive and pacific governance with a rights approach and a culture of resilience.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Results achieved during 2019: - With the program support, the three supported municipalities are implementing financial and public services strategies; have designed tools for planning and territorial ordering aligned to Guatemala´s development Plan K´atun. The three municipalities have Municipal Development Councils - COMUDE working in accordance to the Development Councils Law. The three municipalities have increased their revenues, increased the allocation of funds from Departmental Development Council - CODEDE. Two municipalities (Nebaj and Cotzal) have increased their position in the Municipal Ranking and citizen participation; they have also increased their investments in water and sanitation, education and income generation in Q2.3 million. - The program has supported the improvement of the habitat conditions, food security and child-mother health in the three municipalities. where 1,936 families have increased their consumption and availability of food; improved their habitat by avoiding risks of extreme weather and sanitation; reduced the gastrointestinal and respiratory diseases. - The program has also worked to empower 224 Ixil youth in citizen participation, advocacy, entrepreneurship and income generation. - The program has also contributed to empower 524 women involved in entrepreneurial agriculture and non-agriculture organizations to strengthen their participation and decision making, their advocacy capabilities and to improve their income. - The three Women Municipal Directorates have an assigned budget to support income generation, health and education activities for at least 400 women. - The Program has also contributed to reduce conflict through the support to the inter-institutional dialogue to address agrarian conflicts through the Voluntary Guidelines for Land Governance achieving the solution to 5 agrarian conflicts. - Regarding environment and climate change adaption, the program has supported the training and implementation to introduce practices for protection and management of natural resources with a watershed approach. The Program has achieved to implement 18 agro-ecological practices that have significantly reduced the burning of crop residues and pesticide use. - The Program has also supported the join production (Municipalities, government institutions and community organizations) of 100,000 forest plants and endemic fruit trees; achieving more seeds adapted to the region, increasing the quality and adaptability of the seedlings for reforestation of the upper basin of the five micro basins of the Ixil region.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
